article_title: Rangers Coach Vigneault Tinkers With New Lines
article_text:
The Rangers scored a grand total of one goal in the two games that followed the All-Star break, and that came with 10 seconds left in a game the team lost by three goals. That was when coach Alain Vigneault, ever the reluctant chemist, sneaked into his laboratory.

He devised new forward-line combinations before the Rangers played Carolina on Saturday—”Just looking for something that works,” he said. But nothing clicked. Then he...

twitter.description: Coach Alain Vigneault began shuffling his line combinations when his team was struggling to score goals. On Monday, those juggled lines led the Rangers to six goals in a 6-3 win over the Florida Panthers.
twitter.title: Rangers Coach Vigneault Tinkers With New Lines

article_metadata.author: Dave Caldwell
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Rangers Coach Vigneault Tinkers With His Lines

article_summary:
That was when coach Alain Vigneault, ever the reluctant chemist, sneaked into his laboratory.
He devised new forward-line combinations before the Rangers played Carolina on Saturday—”Just looking for something that works,” he said.
The Rangers scored a grand total of one goal in the two games that followed the All-Star break, and that came with 10 seconds left in a game the team lost by three goals.
But nothing clicked.
